questions.text: A 10-year-old child fell down the stairs. An X-ray was done. Identify the structure injured as marked in the X-ray.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Tibial tuberosity

The given X-ray points towards the tibial tuberosity. This image shows an avulsion fracture of the tibial tuberosity.

questions.text: A man presents with pain and swelling in the forearm. On examination, there is a restriction of rotational movements of the arm. He informs getting injured while defending getting beaten by stick. Which of the following fractures is he most likely to have sustained?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Nightstick fracture

The given clinical scenario is suggestive of nightstick fracture/isolated ulna fracture. Nightstick fracture occurs due to a direct blow on the ulna along its subcutaneous border.

questions.text: An 18-year-old boy complains of fever and pain in the lower limb. There is a localised rise of temperature and tenderness in the region shown in the radiograph. ESR is raised. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ewing’s sarcoma

The clinical features and radiograph showing onion peel type of periosteal reaction point towards a diagnosis of Ewing’s sarcoma.Ewing’s sarcoma is a malignant tumour that occurs more frequently in males, typically between 10 and 20 years of age and has a diaphyseal long-bone location. The femur is the most common long-bone site, followed by the tibia, humerus and fibula. Ewing’s sarcoma is believed to arise from mesenchymal stem cells in the bone marrow.

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy complains of bony pain and swelling in his left upper arm for 3 months. On plain X-ray, the following findings were seen. What is the most likely gene mutation involved in this disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

p53 gene

The given clinical scenario and the X-ray findings of sunray appearance are suggestive of osteosarcoma. The most likely gene mutation is p53 mutation. P53 and RB gene mutations are involved in osteosarcoma and sporadic cases have also been associated with mutations in the CHEK2 gene. RAS, APC, PTEN gene mutations do not have a strong association with osteosarcoma.

questions.text: A 26-year-old athlete came to the orthopedic department with acute onset of pain in the lateral part of the foot while his routine practice. His radiograph of the foot is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Jones fracture

The above radiograph shows a transverse fracture on the base of the 5th metatarsal at the metaphyseal- diaphyseal junction and the most likely diagnosis is Jones fracture. A strong abduction force to the forefoot causes a bending moment in the metaphyseal-diaphyseal junction and results in Jones fracture. This type of injury occurs in a sudden change in direction by an athlete.

questions.text: X-ray spine of a patient with chronic back pain shows characteristic appearance of cod fish vertebrae. What is the investigation of choice to diagnose the underlying condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

DEXA

Cod fish vertebrae in X-ray spine is suggestive of osteoporosis. The investigation of choice for the diagnosis of osteoporosis is dual energy 
X-ray absorptiometry(DEXA). It measures the bone mineral density of an individual. These measurements are made at the lumbar spine or the hip. These measured values are compared using T scores. A T score ≤ -2.5 SD is suggestive of osteoporosis.

questions.text: A 24-year-old adult presents to the ER after a high velocity road traffic accident with tachypnea, petechial haemorrhages in the palpebral conjunctiva and lung crepitations. His femur radiograph is as below. The best treatment option is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

External fixation

External fixation is the best treatment option in the given case. The radiograph shows a femur shaft fracture, and with the additional information in the question, the diagnosis of fat embolism syndrome should be borne in mind. In keeping with the principles of damage control orthopedics, the fracture is initially stabilized by external fixation to prevent further progression of fat embolism. Definitive treatment plans are considered later.

choices.text: Fracture shaft of femur with injury to femoral vessels
Fracture neck of femur with injury to femoral vessels
Anterior dislocation of hip with femoral artery injury

questions.text: A 22-year-old man who had a road traffic accident was brought to the casualty. His left leg is shortened, internally rotated and adducted. The pulsation of the femoral artery is not felt. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Posterior dislocation of hip

Diagnosis of the above clinical scenario is posterior dislocation of the hip. The shortening and attitude of the limb in flexion, adduction and internal rotation is characteristic of posterior dislocation of hip

questions.text: A 37 year-old male motorcyclist presented to the emergency department following a road traffic accident with significant left hip pain and inability to bear weight. The affected leg is in the position as shown in the below image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Anterior dislocation of hip

In the above image, the affected leg is in the state of flexion, abduction and external rotation (FABER). Hence the most likely diagnosis is anterior dislocation of the hip.

questions.text: While examining a patient with a right forearm fracture, you ask him to make a fist. The following finding is noted during this procedure. Which of the following nerves is injured?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Median nerve

The given image shows the pointing index sign and is associated with median nerve injury at the forearm or elbow. Median nerve supplies flexor digitorum superficialis and lateral half of flexor digitorum profundus muscles. Hence injury to the median nerve leads to paralysis of these muscles. This causes inability to flex the index finger and thumb, leading to the pointing index sign.

questions.text: What could be the diagnosis of a woman with this appearance on x-ray?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Multiple enchondromas The diagnosis of the woman is multiple enchondromas. The X-ray shows multiple calcified lesions in the fingers. Multiple enchondromatosis is also known as Ollier disease. It is a tumor in the metaphysis of long bones. There is a failure of bone formation and broadening of unossified cartilage within the bone. This results in shortening and angular deformity of the affected bones with an increased risk of pathological fractures. Enchondromas are also known as Maffucci syndrome if it is associated with overlying soft tissue hemangiomas. 25% of the patients with Ollier’s disease will develop sarcomas by 40 years of age.

questions.text: A 17-year-old boy presents to the clinic with complaints of a painless lump on the lateral aspect of his left knee. The radiograph of the patient is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Osteochondroma

The given radiograph and clinical vignette suggest the diagnosis of osteochondroma

questions.text: A six-year-old child presented with the given deformity. Identify the deformity
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Cubitus valgus

The image shows the cubitus valgus deformity of left elbow most probably arising as a complication of lateral condyle fracture humerus which the patient had 3 years back.

questions.text: Using the X-ray given below. Identify the type of Salter & Harris classification:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The X-ray findings are consistent with a Type 2 Salter-Harris fracture, which is a type of growth plate fracture. A type II Salter-Harris fracture is the most common pediatric physeal fracture, occurring frequently in children over 10 years of age. This fracture breaks at an angle, cutting through most of the growth plate and the metaphysis, the area above the growth plate. The separated piece of the metaphysis is called a Thurston-Holland fragment.

questions.text: A patient had a fall on an outstretched hand. X-ray showed the first MCP joint fracture along with the subluxation. Identify the fracture:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

The Bennett fracture is the most common fracture involving the base of the thumb. This fracture refers to an intraarticular fracture that separates the palmar ulnar aspect of the first metacarpal base from the remaining first metacarpal. The injury is typically caused by axial loading on a partially flexed metacarpal and may be associated with other carpal bone fractures or ligament injuries

questions.text: A patient met with road traffic accident and complained of severe back ache. The X-ray is shown below. What fracture does the patient have?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

Chance fracture

The X-ray shows a vertebral fracture with a horizontal fracture line passing through the body of the vertebra. This indicates Chance fracture. Chance fracture is also known as seat-belt injury or the jack- knife injury. This injury is typically located in the upper lumbar spine in people involved in motor vehicle collisions while wearing a lap seat belt without a shoulder harness. The sudden deceleration causes flexion and posterior distraction of the spine. This causes the mid-lumbar spine to bend like a jack-knife around an axis anterior to the vertebral column.

questions.text: Identify the surgical modality in the image below :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

Ilizarov’s fixator

choices.text: It’s due to excess osteoblastic bone formation
It’s due to low osteoclastic bone resorption
There is a defect in carbonic anhydrase Type 2 proton pump
There is associated bone marrow suppression with pancytopenia

questions.text: Which of the following ain’t true about the following X-rays ?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

It’s due to excess deposition of normal osteoblastic bone formation

questions.text: All of the following are part of the classical triad of the condition shown in the image attached except :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Short stature is a part of KFS but not a part of the classical triad

questions.text: Identify the injury shown in figure :
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)  

Jersey finger
